channel.title: Nutrient Blog — iOS & Swift (filtered)
channel.description: Filtered by content-only keywords: iOS, Objective-C, Swift, SwiftUI, Xcode

item.title: A deep dive into notifications and messages on iOS 26
item.description: Exploring iOS 26’s new Messages API for type-safe notifications and how it addresses concurrency challenges in modern Swift development.

item.title: Exploring interactive snippet intents
item.description: A hands-on exploration of iOS 26’s interactive snippet intents, detailing the learnings and patterns required to create seamless, multistep user experiences outside of an app.

item.title: WWDC at Nutrient
item.description: A look at how Nutrient’s iOS team approaches Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference.

item.title: Beyond iPhone: Developing across Apple platforms
item.description: A quick overview of the available options for codebases that work across Apple platforms and how a pragmatism-over-polish mindset is the way forward. Based on a lightning talk at Swift Craft 2025.

item.title: AI Assistant for iOS and Android: Intelligent document interaction, now in your users’ pockets
item.description: AI Assistant is now available in Nutrient iOS SDK and Nutrient Android SDK for intelligent document interaction.

item.title: Life on the iOS team at Nutrient: Building for the long term
item.description: Working on the iOS team at Nutrient is different from many other iOS development roles. Our iOS team lead shares insights into how we work, the challenges we face, and what’s important to us.

item.title: Choosing the best way to send emails in an iOS app
item.description: Comparing ShareLink, mailto links, and MFMailComposeViewController for integrating sending emails into an iOS app.

item.title: Haptic feedback across iPad and iPhone
item.description: Implementing haptic feedback on iOS by bridging the gap between iPhone and iPad with device checks, because sometimes, 'trust the system' isn’t enough.

item.title: Creating interactive tutorials using DocC
item.description: Create high-quality tutorials using DocC.

item.title: Nutrient SDK 14.2: iOS 18.1 features
item.description: Explore the new features of iOS 18.1, including Writing Tools and Translate in Nutrient SDK 14.2, to elevate your app's productivity and accessibility.

item.title: Customizable SwiftUI toolbar API for developers
item.description: At Nutrient, our mission is to continually enhance the capabilities of our SDKs, making them more powerful and flexible for our customers to use. One of our recent focus areas has been enhancing the SwiftUI capabilities of Nutrient iOS SDK. In particular, we improved our API for customizing the main toolbar.

item.title: Nutrient iOS SDK 14 brings full support for Apple's iOS 18
item.description: We're proud to announce the release of Nutrient iOS SDK 14, offering full support for Apple's iOS 18.

item.title: Dark and Tinted Alternative App Icons
item.description: Updating how we implemented alternative app icons to support iOS 18’s new dark and tinted app icons.

item.title: The rise of generative AI on mobile devices
item.description: The emergence of generative AI on mobile devices and what AI could bring.

item.title: PSPDFKit 13.8 for iOS Brings SwiftUI API to the Main Toolbar
item.description: SwiftUI API is unleashed to the main toolbar in the PSPDFKit 13.8 for iOS update.

item.title: Investigating a dynamic linking crash with Xcode 16
item.description: Debugging and fixing a crash we noticed after updating to Xcode 16.

item.title: Room database for Kotlin Multiplatform projects
item.description: Learn how to seamlessly integrate the Room database into Kotlin Multiplatform projects for local data management.

item.title: NSCopying in a Swift world
item.description: An exploration into how a modern Swift programming mindset clashes with Objective-C’s NSCopying protocol.

item.title: How to sign a PDF on iOS with Nutrient’s signature library
item.description: In this post, you'll learn how to programmatically add electronic and digital signatures to a PDF in your iOS application using Nutrient's iOS signature library.

item.title: Apple Intelligence: A new era in privacy-first AI
item.description: Explore Jonathan's insights on Apple's AI strategy at WWDC24, emphasizing privacy, context, and the partnership with OpenAI for enhanced user experiences.

item.title: Generating API documentation for multiple targets with DocC
item.description: Follow our process of utilizing DocC to create combined API documentation for multiple frameworks.

item.title: Privacy Manifests and Required Reason APIs on iOS
item.description: What privacy manifests and required reason APIs are, and the approach taken by PSPDFKit for adding support for these requirements.

item.title: PSPDFKit 13.4 for iOS: API & Annotation Improvements
item.description: Explore the new features of PSPDFKit 13.4, from revamped API documentation to enhanced multiple annotation selection and navigation links.

item.title: Apple’s vision of our digital future
item.description: Bridging reality and imagination in the digital age through spatial computing and innovative software.

item.title: Nutrient 13.3: LTV for digital signatures
item.description: Explore Nutrient iOS SDK 13.3, featuring long-term validation for digital signatures and support for visionOS.

item.title: PSPDFKit 13.2 for iOS Improves Advanced Digital Signatures
item.description: PSPDFKit 13.2 for iOS adds a flexible new API for Digital Signatures. Additionally, a public preview of PSPDFKit for visionOS is now available.

item.title: Debugging in iOS: Resolving UITextView flickering issues
item.description: A debugging story that includes some tips and tricks

item.title: Using Asset Catalogs for Images
item.description: We discuss the various features of asset catalogs relating to images.

item.title: How to Edit PDFs in an iOS Application Using a PDF Library
item.description: Learn how to edit PDFs in your application using PSPDFKit's iOS PDF library. Learn to edit, crop, rotate, watermark & attach files to PDFs in your iOS app.

item.title: PSPDFKit 13 for iOS 17
item.description: PSPDFKit 13 for iOS adds support for Apple's new operating system versions, improvements to Measurement Tools, and more.

item.title: Adopting UITextInteraction
item.description: Learn how to add UITextInteraction to a custom text input element on iOS, iPadOS, and macOS.

item.title: Exploring SwiftUI for seamless app development
item.description: Read about an engineer's journey using SwiftUI for creating intuitive iOS UI components, enhancing the app development experience.

item.title: Vision Is an Exciting Addition to Apple’s Lineup
item.description: Considering how Apple’s newly announced Vision platform could fit in with its existing platforms.

item.title: PSPDFKit 12.3 for iOS Adds Improvements to Content Editor
item.description: This release adds improvements to Content Editor and includes modernization of our text and image selection menus.

item.title: Customizable UI components on iOS using UIKit
item.description: Providing UI components in UIKit that allow user customization while also providing a default style that works in most cases.

item.title: Conditional Compilation for Apple’s Yearly Updates
item.description: How to smoothly transition an iOS and Mac Catalyst app for Apple’s yearly updates between June and October.

item.title: Developing Mixed-Source Swift Packages
item.description: Tips for publishing Swift packages that include both Swift and Objective-C source files.

item.title: Swift's approach to SPI
item.description: A closer look at how to design a System Programming Interface (SPI) in Swift.

item.title: Optimizing annotation drawing performance
item.description: How we optimized ink annotations and improved performance of several SDK components.

item.title: PSPDFKit 12.1 for iOS Adds Content Editor
item.description: This release of our iOS PDF library adds support for editing original text in PDFs and introduces an overhauled sharing UI.

item.title: SourceKit limitations in Swift API docs
item.description: Explore how we tackled limitations in SourceKit while improving Swift-first API documentation for PSPDFKit, ensuring better developer experience.

item.title: PSPDFKit 12 for iOS 16
item.description: PSPDFKit 12 for iOS adds support for Apple's new operating system version, new edit menus, support for Hebrew, and more.

item.title: Adding a Document Viewer to a Mac Catalyst App
item.description: We discuss how a PDF document viewer can be added to a Mac Catalyst app using the PSPDFKit SDK.

item.title: PSPDFKit 11.5 for iOS Adds Measurement Tools
item.description: This update includes our new Measurement Tools component and refreshes the appearance of some key elements in our user interface.

item.title: PDF measurement tools for architects and engineers
item.description: Discover PDF measurement tools for accurate distance, area, and perimeter measurements directly in your documents.

item.title: Download Failures with Swift Package Manager Binary Targets
item.description: A tale of how reading an error message more carefully allowed us to work around an issue with our tooling.

item.title: Replicating the iOS Text Magnifying Glass
item.description: A dive into details of how we replicated the system magnifying glass on iOS.

item.title: Our Attempt at Rewriting PSPDFKit Catalog in SwiftUI
item.description: We tried rewriting a part of our PSPDFKit Catalog example project in SwiftUI. Here's what we learned.

item.title: PSPDFKit 11.4 for iOS Adds Electronic Signature Customizations
item.description: PSPDFKit 11.4 for iOS adds more customization options to Electronic Signatures and sunsets support for iOS 13.

item.title: Cross-platform mobile frameworks — An iOS engineer's perspective
item.description: What I learned while working on cross-platform mobile frameworks.

item.title: PSPDFKit 11.3 for iOS Adds Cloud Annotation Tool
item.description: PSPDFKit 11.3 for iOS adds a dedicated tool to create cloud annotations, improves the performance of ink annotations, and adds Swift Package Manager support for PDFXKit.

item.title: Presenting Popovers on iPhone with SwiftUI
item.description: How to present the UI as popovers on iPhone when using SwiftUI.

item.title: Download and display PDFs in Flutter
item.description: Learn to download and display PDF documents in your Flutter app using Dio and a PDF SDK with step-by-step code examples.

item.title: PSPDFKit 11.2 for iOS Adds Instant Collaboration Permissions
item.description: We’re excited to announce the addition of Instant Collaboration Permissions and the return of the text magnifying glass with PSPDFKit 11.2 for iOS.

item.title: Loading Images on iOS 15
item.description: We discuss the new iOS 15 APIs provided by UIKit for loading and displaying images and the SwiftUI APIs for loading an image from a remote URL.

item.title: Understanding fast-math
item.description: What does the -ffast-math optimization really do, and when is it safe to use it?

item.title: How to Digitally Sign a PDF Using a YubiKey
item.description: This blog post describes how you can integrate PSPDFKit for iOS and a YubiKey to sign PDFs via NFC using an iPhone.

item.title: Using Instant Layers for Onsite Visits
item.description: We talk about how the layers feature of Instant can be used for construction site visits.

item.title: Fitting Text into a Bounding Frame on iOS
item.description: How to use a binary search algorithm to precisely fit multiline text into a bounding frame on iOS.

item.title: What Is a Deprecated API on iOS?
item.description: A look at Apple's API evolution strategy and the effect of the deployment target and base SDK Xcode project settings.

item.title: PSPDFKit 11.1 for iOS Enhances Document Comparison
item.description: PSPDFKit 11.1 for iOS adds support for macOS 12 Monterey and manual alignment to the Document Comparison workflow.

item.title: PSPDFKit 11 for iOS 15
item.description: PSPDFKit 11 for iOS adds support for Apple's new operating system version.

item.title: Swift render tests in practice — Part III
item.description: Enhance your Swift UI testing with advanced render test techniques. Learn to visualize image differences, automate reference image generation, and integrate visual diffs directly into your CI pipeline.

item.title: Swift render tests in practice — Part II
item.description: Improve your Swift UI render tests by enhancing failure diagnostics. Learn to utilize .xcresult bundles, XCTAttachment, and XCTContext to streamline debugging and integrate detailed test outputs into your CI workflow.

item.title: Swift render tests in practice — Part I
item.description: Discover how to implement render tests in Xcode for custom drawing code. Learn when to use them, how they compare images to catch regressions, and why they're essential for maintaining visual fidelity in iOS and macOS apps.

item.title: Reverse engineering UIKit to fix our top crash
item.description: This blog post describes the process of reverse engineering UIKit to identify and fix our top crash in PSPDFKit for iOS.

item.title: Automating Test Retries
item.description: We walk through our experience of dealing with flaky tests by automatically retrying them.

item.title: Debugging Image Loading and Cropping Performance on iOS
item.description: We talk about using the Image I/O and Core Graphics APIs to improve the image loading and cropping performance in the PSPDFKit iOS SDK.

item.title: PSPDFKit 10.5 for iOS Adds Instant Document Permissions
item.description: PSPDFKit 10.5 for iOS adds Instant document permissions, redesigned getting started guides, and preliminary compatibility with iOS 15.

item.title: How to Open a PDF in React Native Using the Document Picker
item.description: A video tutorial about how to open a PDF in React Native using the document browser.

item.title: Automating Mac Catalyst Distribution with fastlane
item.description: We recently automated PDF Viewer for Mac distribution via fastlane. Here’s how you can do the same for your Mac Catalyst app.

item.title: PSPDFKit 10.4 for iOS Introduces an Overhauled Undo Architecture
item.description: PSPDFKit 10.4 for iOS with an overhauled undo architecture, new examples, and TIFF support for image documents.

item.title: Adding annotations in Swift with PDFKit vs. Nutrient
item.description: A post that compares adding annotations in Apple’s PDFKit and Nutrient.

item.title: SwiftUI In Production
item.description: We recently shipped a major new feature in SwiftUI while still supporting iOS 12 in our SDK. Here's what we learned.

item.title: PSPDFKit 10.3 introduces new features
item.description: Explore PSPDFKit 10.3 for iOS with new electronic signatures and instant comments, enhancing collaboration and document signing experiences.

item.title: Creating and Filling Forms Programmatically in Swift
item.description: This blog post explains the process of creating and filling PDF forms programmatically in Swift.

item.title: Streams of Cocoa: Why It's Still Worth Knowing NSStream
item.description: In this post, we'll look at a piece of API that many people rarely touch, if ever: Stream. It’s neither new nor shiny, but it's a powerful tool when you know how to use it.

item.title: Advances in XCFrameworks
item.description: With Xcode 12, Apple improved the XCFramework format, which unlocks great new capabilities.

item.title: Deflaking CI Tests with xcresults
item.description: We’re sharing some techniques for tracking down and fixing flaky Xcode tests on CI.

item.title: Keyboard Navigation in SwiftUI
item.description: SwiftUI wasn’t built with keyboard support in mind, and it shows. Learn how you can rewrite keyboardShortcut to work with iOS 13 and access the underlying navigation controller to pop views on ⌘-Left Arrow.

item.title: PSPDFKit for Magazines
item.description: How to configure PSPDFKit for a magazine.

item.title: Using the Document Browser in SwiftUI to Open a PDF
item.description: With iOS 14, Apple made it incredibly easy to integrate the document browser into SwiftUI-powered apps.

item.title: PSPDFKit for Construction
item.description: How to configure PSPDFKit to display a building floorplan.

item.title: Nutrient for e-readers
item.description: How to configure Nutrient for an e-reader app.

item.title: How to Bridge Native PSPDFKit for iOS Code to Flutter
item.description: A tutorial about how to bridge native PSPDFKit iOS code to Flutter.

item.title: PSPDFKit for E-Learning
item.description: How PSPDFKit can be configured for taking and grading an e-learning exam.

item.title: Using the SwiftUI ColorPicker on iOS and macOS
item.description: While macOS has offered a system-provided color picker since OS X 10.0 Cheetah, iOS developers had to wait a bit longer. Let's take a closer look at the new ColorPicker (SwiftUI) and UIColorPickerViewController (UIKit) controls.

item.title: PSPDFKit for Board Meetings
item.description: How PSPDFKit can be used to create or join a collaborative editing session for a board meeting.

item.title: Continuous integration: From Jenkins to Buildkite
item.description: Learn why we moved from Jenkins to Buildkite, what the current most promising services are, and how we evaluated them.

item.title: PSPDFKit for Aviation
item.description: How to configure PSPDFKit to display a flight manual and passenger list documents.

item.title: PSPDFKit 10.2 for iOS Adds New Examples on GitHub
item.description: PSPDFKit 10.2 for iOS adds new examples on GitHub, seamless document downloading, performance improvements, and more.

item.title: Automating macOS provisioning with Chef
item.description: Learn how to use Chef to automatically provision macOS machines for CI: infrastructure as code

item.title: How to Unlock PDF Functionality with OCR in iOS
item.description: This blog post covers how to integrate OCR functionality in iOS, perform OCR, and leverage functionality such as extraction, selection, highlight, and search.

item.title: Managing macOS hardware: Virtualization or bare metal?
item.description: We explore the different ways to run macOS in the cloud, comparing virtualization via VMware, Anka, and Orka with running a fleet of bare metal machines on Amazon or MacStadium.

item.title: Continuous integration for small iOS/macOS teams
item.description: In this new series, we're sharing our approach to macOS continuous integration for smaller teams that can't dedicate an entire team to CI management or aren't willing to invest five-figure sums per year for their setup.

item.title: Convert a PDF to an image in Swift
item.description: This blog post explains how to convert your PDF file to an image using Core Graphics, PDFKit, and Nutrient.

item.title: PSPDFKit 10.1 Takes SwiftUI to the Next Level
item.description: PSPDFKit 10.1 for iOS adds support for macOS Big Sur and Apple Silicon, and it improves SwiftUI integration options and Scribble interactions.

item.title: Caching file downloads with URLCache in Swift
item.description: Apple has a sophisticated caching system in iOS, which is enabled by default. However, documentation around URLCache is quite sparse. Today, we'll look at the behavior of caching when dealing with large files.

item.title: Presenting popovers from SwiftUI
item.description: Is there a way to present UIKit popovers from toolbar buttons managed by SwiftUI?

item.title: Extending the Scribble User Experience
item.description: How to customize the default Scribble experience to allow users to start writing anywhere.

item.title: An Introduction to LLDB Reproducers
item.description: An introduction to an experimental feature in LLDB, Reproducers, that helps reproduce bugs in the debugger itself.

item.title: Adding Multimedia Content to a PDF as a Gallery
item.description: This post is about the Gallery API in PSPDFKit for iOS that can be used to add interactive multimedia content to a PDF.

item.title: PSPDFKit 10 for iOS 14
item.description: PSPDFKit 10 for iOS adds support for Apple's new operating system, enables SwiftPM integration, and improves content accessibility.

item.description: What we learned from experimenting with binary frameworks as Swift packages in Xcode 12.

item.title: Using Metal to Apply Image Filters
item.description: An overview of how to use Metal to apply filters to images to perform a simple color inversion on the input image.

item.title: Optical Character Recognition in Scanned PDFs
item.description: An overview of how OCR can enhance scanned documents to speed up common operations. We explain what OCR is, why it's useful, and how it works.

item.title: Why Is the PDF Format So Well Supported on Apple Platforms?
item.description: Apple has a rich history of supporting the PDF file format, but when and how did its relationship with the PDF format begin?

item.title: The Case for Lists in UICollectionView
item.description: Exploring the power and flexibility offered by creating lists using UICollectionView.

item.description: Discover how to prevent crashes during selective updates in table views and collection views, ensuring smooth iOS app performance.

item.description: PSPDFKit 9.5 for iOS introduces the new OCR component and a revamped touch handling system.

item.description: Apple introduced the objc_direct attribute in Xcode 12. Learn what it does and how you can use it to your advantage.

item.description: What we learned about XCFrameworks while migrating Nutrient to this new format.

item.title: PSPDFKit 9.4 for iOS
item.description: Introducing PSPDFKit 9.4 for iOS, which features Office Files Support, a new Reader View component, package manager enhancements, and much more.

item.description: This post describes how to use PSPDFKit for iOS and Core Image to perform facial redaction in PDF documents.

item.description: In iOS 11, Smart Punctuation caused data loss. Learn how we fixed the issue and how we are now cleaning up the OS-level workaround.

item.description: How to make your iOS app work well with scrolling, secondary clicking and dragging on a trackpad or mouse.

item.description: This blog post talks in detail about the blur effect materials on iOS and the challenges we faced in picking the appropriate effect for our SDK.

item.description: Learn how to automate measurement runs with Instruments.

item.description: Objective-C stores type encoding in the binary. These encodings can become surprisingly large.

item.description: Introducing PSPDFKit 9.3 for iOS, which features refined Swift APIs, iPad cursor support, stricter adherence to PDF document permissions, and much more.

item.description: Apple introduced new pointer events in iOS 13.4 to better support trackpad and mouse devices.

item.description: A comprehensive overview of adopting Dark Mode in an iOS app, along with a few tips to make the process of development easier.

item.description: PSPDFKit 9 for iOS introduces Mac Catalyst support, as well as many great new iOS 13 features such as native Dark Mode and multi-window support.

item.description: We show you how to annotate a PDF with an image via PDFKit.

item.description: We provide a step-by-step explanation of how to convert an image to a PDF.

item.description: This article goes into what's involved when incrementally or fully saving a PDF, and why it matters.

item.description: A tutorial about how to convert simple HTML to PDF using Swift.

item.description: Introducing PSPDFKit 8.2 for iOS — featuring an extended and redesigned bookmark UI, updated half modals, and significant performance improvements.
